p: The interaction between molecular chains of G is high and leads to high TS. The effect of G on TS was also reported by Park ( 1999), who investigated on methylcellulose and hydroxypropylmethylcellulose films. Mohanty et al. ( 2000) and Chen and Lai ( 2008) reported that films developed from CMC had a high TS and G yielded ELB reduction significantly ( p < .05). Thus, the higher the level of G in the formulae, the lower the flexibility.
